ALTA 2013 Programme

The programme below is a draft and some details may change.

Registration will be open from 08:30 on Thursday 5th in Level 5 of P-block on QUT Gardens Point campus. All the sessions (except for the poster session and ADCS joint session) will be located in P-512 (Level 5). The ALTA-ADCS joint Keynote and the joint session will be in P421. Lunches (except for the tutorial day) are served in Level 6.

Wednesday 4 December

Start time: 10am

Tutorial 1: Working with the HCS vLab
10:00-12:00Tutorial 1, part 1
12:00-13:00Lunch break
13:00-14:30Tutorial 1, part 2
Tutorial 2: Applying Wikipedia as a machine-readable knowledge base
15:00-16:30Tutorial 2, part 1
16:30-16:45Short break
16:45-17:45Tutorial 2, part 2

Thursday 5 December

08:50-09:00Opening remarks
9:00-10:00Keynote: Bonnie WebberConcurrent Discourse Relations
10:00-10:30Break
10:30-12:00Session 1- Marco Lui and Paul Cook. Classifying English Documents by National Dialect
- Tim O'Keefe, Kellie Webster, James R. Curran and Irena Koprinska. Examining the Impact of Coreference Resolution on Quote Attribution
- Yvette Graham, Timothy Baldwin, Alistair Moffat and Justin Zobel. Crowd-Sourcing of Human Judgments of Machine Translation Fluency
12:00-13:30Lunch Break
13:30-15:00Session 2- Shunichi Ishihara. The Effect of the Within-speaker Sample Size on the Performance of Likelihood Ratio Based Forensic Voice Comparison: Monte Carlo Simulations
- Hanna Suominen and Gabriela Ferraro. Noise in Speech-to-Text Voice: Analysis of Errors and Feasibility of Phonetic Similarity for Their Correction
- Robert Power, Bella Robinson and David Ratcliffe. Finding Fires with Twitter
15:00-15:30Break
15:30-16:50Session 3- Tatyana Shmanina, Ingrid Zukerman, Antonio Jimeno Yepes, Lawrence Cavedon and Karin Verspoor. Impact of Corpus Diversity and Complexity on NER Performance
- Rolf Schwitter. Working with Defaults in a Controlled Natural Language
- Asif Ekbal, Sriparna Saha, Diego Molla and K Ravikumar. Multi-Objective Optimization for Clustering of Medical Publications
16:50-17:20Business Meeting
19:00Conference Dinner at Plough Inn, South Bank

Friday 6 December

9:00-10:00Keynote: Mark SteedmanRobust Computational Semantics (Joint with ADCS)
10:00-10:30Break
10:30-12:30Joint ALTA-ADCS Session- ADCS paper (Conditional Collocation in Japanese)
- ADCS paper (Visual Text Summarision for Surveillance and Situational Awareness in Hospitals)
- Antti Puurula. Cumulative Progress in Language Models for Information Retrieval
- Oldooz Dianat, Cecile Paris, and Stephen Wan. A Study: From Electronic Laboratory Notebooks to Generated Queries for Literature Recommendation
12:30-13:30Lunch Break
13:30-14:00ALTA Shared Task- Diego Molla. ALTA 2013 Shared Task overview
- Marco Lui and Li Wang. Recovering Casing and Punctuation using Conditional Random Fields
14:00-14:50Session 5- Shunichi Ishihara. A Comparative Study of Likelihood Ratio Based Forensic Text Comparison in Procedures: Multivariate Kernel Density vs. Gaussian Mixture Model-Universal Background Model
- Farshid Zavareh, Ingrid Zukerman, Su Nam Kim and Thomas Kleinbauer. Error Detection in Automatic Speech Recognition
14:50--15:05Awards and final remarks
15:05--15:20ALTA Poster Boosters- Jared Willett, Timothy Baldwin, David Martinez and J. Angus Webb. Automatic Climate Classification of Environmental Science Literature
- Jason Brown and Sam Mandal. Rhythm, Metrics, and the Link to Phonology
- Shunichi Ishihara. Differences in Speaker Individualising Information between Case Particles and Fillers in Spoken Japanese
15:30-17:00Posters and cocktail with ADCS

End of programme: 5pm
